results.title: The Stunt woman [Dubbed version]
results.creator_credit: Ann Hui, Catherine Hun, David Lau, Daca Entertainment and Golden Bowl
results.brief_description: Ah Kam (Michelle Yeoh) is a stuntwoman trying to break into the male dominated arena of the martial art movie. A fearless perfectionist, intent on making her mark and earning the respect of her peers, she teams with a director known as ‘The Chief’ with whom she forms a professional and personal bond. On his latest flick The Chief is working against a tight deadline and places his stunt crew in jeopardy in order to get the job done. Kam displays a loyalty to The Chief that compromises her wellbeing as she performs some terrifying stunts whilst injured. Several subplots involve bar room brawling, the Hong Kong triads, after hours carousing and romance for Kam with a duplicitous playboy. Yeoh is convincing as Kam, a woman with ambition and determination to make it in a tough arena whilst displaying a familial loyalty to her colleagues. The film is an interesting behind the scenes look at the making of martial arts movies and the danger of injury that hangs over career stunt men and women. Yeoh was seriously injured during one stunt, jumping from a bridge, the footage of which is screened under the end credits. Dubbed version in English.

results.title: The Studio workshop
results.creator_credit: George Lewin and Triton Manufacturing and Design Company
results.brief_description: This comprehensive two cassette programme provides the home improver with a step by step guide how to plan and build a studio workshop. Hosted by George Lewin, inventor of the Triton Workcentre, the video provides dozens of labour saving tips, and makes effective use of computer generated graphics to clarify techniques and principles. Tape one covers site preparation, laying foundations, bricklaying, wall and roof framing. Tape two covers wall and roof cladding, windows and doors, as well as fitout.

results.title: The Structure of protein
results.creator_credit: John Armstrong, George Seager, De La Cheura Films and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: Describes the composition of an amino acid and shows how these acids form polypeptide chains of which proteins are composed. Briefly discusses the techniques used to determine the precise structure of a protein.

results.title: The Stress mess
results.creator_credit: Ron Underwood, Mark Chodzko and Barr Films
results.brief_description: This humorous yet hard hitting film follows the Wilson family - Fred, Stacey and their college student daughter, Karen - through a typical stress filled day. The program teaches the importance of setting priorities, delegating tasks, learning to say “No”, and learning how to relax.

results.title: The Streets of Saigon
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This is a “social study” in the true sense, filmed in the streets of Saigon while the Vietnamese war was still going strong. Life went on fairly normally except for the noticeable presence of the military, and the number of children, orphaned, homeless, thrown on their own resources to make a living in the streets. It is these children who are in the forefront of the film, along with some American volunteers who tried to help them. Includes the work of Stephen Erhart with the children.

results.title: The Street
results.creator_credit: Caroline Leaf, Guy Glover, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This award-winning animated film spares no feelings, minces no words. A poignant interpretation of a short story from Montreal author Mordecai Richler’s ‘The Street’, it makes what is sometimes an embarrassingly frank statement about how many families respond to their old and infirm members. In soft simple washes of watercolour and ink, the filmmaker interprets reactions to a dying grandmother, capturing family feelings and distilling them into harsh reality. Awards: Twenty-two including Oscar nomination, Hollywood; Toronto; Los Angeles; Melbourne. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Stranger = Agantuk
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray, Erato FIlms, National Film Development Corporation of India, OD Productions and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: Agantuk (The Stranger)” was Satyajit Ray’s last film, and one in which he broke his tradition of filming in black and white to shoot in colour for the first time. Anila, a middle class woman living comfortably in Calcutta with her husband and young son, receives a letter from a person claiming to be her long lost uncle, and who wishes to re-establish contact with his family after travelling the world for the past 35 years. Anila’s husband, Sudhindra, suspects that the uncle may be a con-man and a thief, out to infiltrate their household in order to claim an old inheritance, and Anila is torn between this suspicion and her sense of family hospitality and obligation. A week long trial visit is agreed upon so that the true identity of Manmohan can be verified and the stranger moves into their house. He quickly befriends their young son with gifts and stories, then sets about the more difficult task of establishing his credibility to the family and their invited friends who set out to test him. As he explains his wanderlust and his lifelong interest in studying - what makes a particular culture “civilised” during his travels, those in his company begin to fall under his spell. The irony of his accounts of being welcomed into “primitive” societies, while his own family, living in a comfortable urban setting, hold him at arms length is not lost. Through the process the family is drawn to re-examining its values in this light. Cast includes Deepankar De, Mamata Shankar, Bikram Bannerjee and Utpal Dutt. In Bengali with English subtitles.

results.title: The Strands grow
results.creator_credit: George Brewer, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, New York Zoological Society and The Conservation Foundation
results.brief_description: Uses fossil remains and other prehistoric records to make the point that communities of plants and animals have existed on earth only to be replaced by others when they have failed to adjust themselves to changes in their environment. The growth and development of the climax forest is shown in detail to emphasise the meaning and significance of a state of balance in nature.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Brewer, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, New York Zoological Society and The Conservation Foundation

results.title: The Stowaway
results.creator_credit: Grant Crabtree, Tim Wilson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A story of a boy, a fishing schooner, and an adventure at sea. A thirteen-year-old boy stows away on his father’s schooner and learns all about deep-sea fishing when the vessel reaches the famous Grand Banks fishing grounds off the coast of Newfoundland. The graceful “Jean Frances” is one of the few remaining Bluenose vessels that still put to sea from their home ports of Riverport and Lunenberg.
